definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

pinyin: tong2 bu4 shu4 wei4 jie1 ceng2
zheng3 ti3 shu4 wei4 fu2 wu4 wang3 lu4
zheng3 ti3 fu2 wu4 shu4 wei4 wang3 lu4
zong1 he2 fu2 wu4 shu4 wei4 wang3 luo4

sentences.english: So I put a small camera over there, that acts as a digital eye.
sentences.chinese: 所以我加了一個小攝影機，當作數位眼睛。

sentences.english: If field width is smaller than the number of digit, it will display ONE decimal places.
sentences.chinese: 如果欄寬小過實數的數位，便會顯示一個小數位。

sentences.english: If field width is smaller than the number of digit, it will display ONE decimal places.
sentences.chinese: 如果欄寬小過實數的數位，便會顯示一個小數位。

sentences.english: He reigns as the top Hallyu Star and often is described with numbers.
sentences.chinese: 他是頂級韓流明星，並且經常被人與數位連在一起。

sentences.english: Manufacturer of electronic musical instruments and digital recording products.
sentences.chinese: 製造業者電子的音樂樂器和數位錄音的產品。

sentences.english: Mr Uribe freed scores of guerrilla prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 烏里維釋放了數位被捕的游擊隊員。

sentences.english: Digital Image Processing, second edition, by Gonzalez & Woods.
sentences.chinese: 數位影像處理，譯者，徐曉佩，高立出版社。

sentences.english: Digital recording offers the best sound quality.
sentences.chinese: 數位式的錄音提供最好的音質。

sentences.english: Aimec sees through a single digital eye, allowing it to move freely around the house.
sentences.chinese: 此外，艾米克還能通過一隻數位眼在屋子裏行動自如。

sentences.english: Not digital photos retouched by any photo editing software.
sentences.chinese: 非任何軟體所修編的數位相片。

sentences.english: Some dig-ital money providers refer to the account as an electronic wallet.
sentences.chinese: 一些數位錢供給者提及帳戶如一個電子的皮夾。

sentences.english: The digitalized operations and adjustments enable the LCD panel to display or store the setting.
sentences.chinese: 數位化的操作及調整，可由液晶面板顯示設定或儲存。

sentences.english: Even Spielberg, who wears many hats, sees the efficacy of digital.
sentences.chinese: 就算是身兼數職的史匹柏，也見識到了數位的效率。
由這個小數位引出的差距卻是巨大的。

sentences.english: The general and his aides spoke disrespectfully about several administration officials.
sentences.chinese: 將軍和他的助手對數位政府官員發表了無理的言論。

sentences.english: Today, more and more power-control functions are partly or completely digital.
sentences.chinese: 如今，愈來愈多的電源控制功能已部分或完全數位化。

definition: to put to use/to apply/practical/applied (science, linguistics etc)/application/practical use/(computing) app
to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
entity/substance/thing that has a material existence (as opposed to a conceptual, virtual or online existence)/the real thing (as opposed to an image or model of it)
imitation/to simulate/to imitate/analog (device, as opposed to digital)
